declarations.name: RhAccordion
declarations.summary: Expands or collapses a stacked list of panels
declarations.description:
An accordion is a stacked list of panels which allows users to expand or collapse information
when selected. They feature panels that consist of a section text label and a caret icon that
collapses or expands to reveal more information.

members.name: accents
members.description: Sets accordion header's accents position to inline or bottom

members.name: large
members.description: If this accordion uses large styles

members.name: colorPalette
members.description: Color Palette for this accordion.

members.name: expandedIndex
members.description:
Sets and reflects the currently expanded accordion 0-based indexes.
Use commas to separate multiple indexes.
```html
<rh-accordion expanded-index="1,2">
...
</rh-accordion>
```

open

declarations.name: RhAlert
declarations.summary: Notifies a user without blocking their workflow
declarations.description:
An alert is a banner used to notify a user about a change in status
or communicate other information. It can be generated with or without
a user triggering an action first.

members.name: toast
members.description: Toast a message with an rh-alert

members.name: state
members.description:
Communicates the urgency of a message and is denoted by various styling configurations.

- `neutral` - Indicates generic information or a message with no severity.
- `danger` - Indicates a danger state, like an error that is blocking a user from completing a task.
- `warning` - Indicates a warning state, like a non-blocking error that might need to be fixed.
- `caution` - Indicates an action or notice which should immediately draw the attention
- `info` - Indicates helpful information or a message with very little to no severity.
- `success` - Indicates a success state, like if a process was completed without errors.

Note: 'note', 'default', and 'error' will also work, but are deprecated

members.name: variant
members.description:
The alternate Inline alert style includes a border instead of a line which
can be used to express more urgency or better grab the attention of a user.

A Toast alert is used to present a global message about an event,
update, or confirmation, like the result of a user action that cannot
be presented within a specific layout or component.

members.name: dismissable
members.description:
Alert variants have different rules regarding their ability to be dismissed by a user.
Default, Info, and Success Inline alerts can be dismissed by a user selecting the close button.
Warning and Danger Inline alerts can be dismissed by a user resolving the issues caused by the alert.
All Toast alerts can be dismissed by a user selecting the close button or waiting for them to time out.

declarations.name: RhAnnouncement
declarations.summary: Arranges content and interactive elements in a layout
declarations.description:
Announcements are flexible surfaces used to group information in a full width banner layout, traditionally across the top of a page.
They are used to announce new features, promos, or news.

members.name: dismissable

members.name: imagePosition
members.description:

- `inline-start`
- `block-start`

declarations.name: RhBadge
declarations.summary: Annotates information like a label or object
declarations.description:
A badge is used to annotate other information like a label or an object name.

- `neutral` - Indicates generic information or a message with no severity.
- `danger` - Indicates a danger state, like an error that is blocking a user from completing a task.
- `warning` - Indicates a warning state, like a non-blocking error that might need to be fixed.
- `caution` - Indicates an action or notice which should immediately draw the attention
- `info` - Indicates helpful information or a message with very little to no severity.
- `success` - Indicates a success state, like if a process was completed without errors.

members.name: state
members.description:
Denotes the state-of-affairs this badge represents
Note: 'moderate','important', and 'critical' will also work, but are deprecated

members.name: number
members.description:
Sets a numeric value for a badge.

You can pair it with `threshold` attribute to add a `+` sign
if the number exceeds the threshold value.

members.name: threshold
members.description:
Sets a threshold for the numeric value and adds `+` sign if
the numeric value exceeds the threshold value.

members.name: stateChanged
members.description: Ensures that state is consistent, regardless of input

declarations.name: RhButton
declarations.summary: Triggers actions on the page or in the background
declarations.description:
A button is clickable text or an icon that triggers an action on the page or in the background.
Depending on the action, content, and hierarchy, a button can be used on its own or grouped with
other buttons.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the button

members.name: type
members.description: button type

members.name: label
members.description: Accessible name for the button, use when the button does not have slotted text

members.name: value
members.description: Form value for the button

members.name: name
members.description: Form name for the button

members.name: icon
members.description: Shorthand for the `icon` slot, the value is icon name

members.name: iconSet
members.description: Icon set for the `icon` property - 'ui' by default

members.name: variant
members.description:
Changes the style of the button.
- Primary: Used for the most important call to action on a page. Try to
limit primary buttons to one per page.
- Secondary: Use secondary buttons for general actions on a page, that
donâ€™t require as much emphasis as primary button actions. For example,
you can use secondary buttons where there are multiple actions, like in
toolbars or data lists.
- Tertiary: Tertiary buttons are flexible and can be used as needed.

members.name: danger
members.description:
Use danger buttons for actions a user can take that are potentially
destructive or difficult/impossible to undo, like deleting or removing
user data.

declarations.name: RhCard
declarations.summary: Arranges content and interactive elements in a layout
declarations.description: Cards are flexible surfaces used to group information in a small layout. They give small previews of information or provide secondary content in relation to the content it's near. Several cards can be used together to group related information.

members.name: colorPalette
members.description:
Sets color palette, which affects the element's styles as well as descendants' color theme.
Overrides parent color context.
Your theme will influence these colors so check there first if you are seeing inconsistencies.
See [CSS Custom Properties](#css-custom-properties) for default values

members.name: variant
members.description: Change the style of the card to be a "Promo"

members.name: fullWidth
members.description: Change a promo with an image + body + footer to use the `full-width` style

slots.name: header

declarations.name: RhCodeBlock
declarations.summary: Formats code strings within a container
declarations.description: A code block applies special formatting to sections of code.

members.name: actions
members.description: Space- or comma-separated list of code block action buttons to display, containing either 'copy', 'wrap', or both. 'copy' adds a button that copies the text content to the clipboard. 'wrap' adds a button that toggles line wrap. To override the default labels, e.g. for purposes of internationalization, use the `action-label-copy` and `action-label-wrap` slots. Each slot may receive two elements, one for the action's default state (e.g. "Copy to clipboard"), and one for the actions alternative state, e.g. "Copied!". The active-state element must have the attributes `hidden data-code-block-state="active"`

members.name: highlighting
members.description:
When set to "client", `<rh-code-block>` will automatically highlight the source using Prism.js
When set to "Prerendered", `<rh-code-block>` will apply supported RHDS styles to children with
prismjs classnames in the element's root.

members.name: compact

members.name: dedent

members.name: resizable

members.name: fullHeight
members.description: When set, the code block occupies it's full height, without scrolling

members.name: lineNumbers

declarations.name: RhCta
declarations.summary: A call to action is styled text representing a link.
declarations.description: A call to action is styled text representing a link.

members.name: variant
members.description:
Indicates the importance of this call-to-action in the context of the page.
Will also influence how the call-to-action is styled.
- **Primary**: Use for the primary or most important link. This variant is the highest in
hierarchy and can also be used to play a video in a Modal or large container.
- **Secondary**: Use for secondary or general links. This variant is lower in hierarchy than
the Primary variant and can be used multiple times in the same container or layout.
- **Brick**: Use to group links together. Only the Brick variant can stretch to fit a
container or grid, otherwise the text label padding in other variants stays the same.
- Default (no variant): Use for tertiary or the least important links. This variant is the
lowest in hierarchy and can be used multiple times in the same container or layout.

members.description: When set, overrides the default slot. Use *instead* of a slotted anchor tag

members.name: target

declarations.name: RhDialog
declarations.summary: Communicates information requiring user input or action
declarations.description: A dialog displays important information to users without requiring them to navigate away from the page.

members.name: variant
members.description:
The `variant` controls the width of the dialog.
There are three options: `small`, `medium` and `large`. The default is `large`.

members.name: position
members.description: `position="top"` aligns the dialog with the top of the page

members.name: accessibleLabel
members.description:
Use `accessible-label="My custom label"` to specify the dialog's accessible name.
Defaults to the name of the dialog trigger if no attribute is set and no headings exist in the modal.
See Dialog's Accessibility page for more info.

members.name: open
members.description: `open` / `open="open"` declaratively opens the dialog

members.name: trigger
members.description: Optional ID of the trigger element

members.name: type
members.description: Use `type="video"` to embed a video player into a dialog.

members.name: toggle
members.description:
Manually toggles the dialog.
```js
dialog.toggle();
```

members.name: show
members.description:
Manually opens the dialog.
```js
dialog.show();
```

members.name: close
members.description:
Manually closes the dialog.

```js
dialog.close();
```

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:

attributes.name: position

attributes.name: accessible-label

Use `accessible-label="My custom label"` to specify the dialog's accessible name.

attributes.description: Use `type="video"` to embed a video player into a dialog.

events.name: open
events.description: Fires when a user clicks on the trigger or manually opens a dialog.

declarations.summary: A disclosure toggles the visibility of content when triggered
declarations.description: A disclosure toggles the visibility of content when triggered.

members.name: preventEscElements
members.default:
[
    'input:not([type="hidden"]):not([type="radio"])',

    // Elements that need the :disabled selector:
    ...[
      'input[type="radio"]',
      'select',
      'textarea',
      'rh-audio-player',
      'rh-dialog',
    ].map(selector => `${selector}:not([inert]):not([inert] *):not([tabindex^='-']):not(:disabled)`),

    // Elements that don't need the :disabled selector:
    ...[
      'iframe',
      'audio[controls]',
      'video[controls]',
      '[contenteditable]',
    ].map(selector => `${selector}:not([inert]):not([inert] *):not([tabindex^='-'])`),
  ].join(',')

declarations.name: RhIcon
declarations.summary: Decorative element which supports related content
declarations.description:
Icons represents general concepts and can support text as a decorative
element. The icon element is a container that allows users to add icons of
varying dimensions in the same area without shifting surrounding content.

members.name: set
members.description: Icon set

members.name: icon
members.description: Icon name

members.name: accessibleLabel
members.description:
Defines a string value that labels the icon element.
Adds role="img" to element.

members.name: loading
members.description:
Controls how eager the element will be to load the icon data
- `eager`: eagerly load the icon, blocking the main thread
- `idle`: wait for the browser to attain an idle state before loading
- `lazy` (default): wait for the element to enter the viewport before loading

declarations.name: RhMenuDropdown
declarations.summary: A collapsible menu for presenting a list of options or actions
declarations.description:
A menu dropdown presents a list of actions or links in a vertically stacked menu,
appearing when a user interacts with a toggle button.

members.name: open
members.description: whether the dropdown is currently open.

members.name: variant
members.description:
Defines the visual style of the dropdown.
Setting it to 'borderless' removes the default border styling.

members.name: layout
members.description: The 'compact' layout reduces spacing and add the rh-icon `ellipsis-vertical-fill`.

members.name: disabled
members.description:
Disables user interaction with the dropdown. When true, the dropdown cannot
be opened or interacted with, and appears visually disabled.

members.name: accessibleLabel
members.description:
Provides an accessible name for the dropdown's trigger, improving screen reader support.
This label is announced to assistive technologies to describe the purpose of
the compact menu dropdown.

members.name: focus
members.description: Moves focus to the currently active (focused) item.

attributes.name: open

attributes.name: disabled

attributes.name: accessible-label
attributes.description:
Provides an accessible name for the dropdown's trigger, improving screen reader support.
This label is announced to assistive technologies to describe the purpose of
the compact menu dropdown.

slots.name: toggle-label
slots.description: Use this slot for the toggle label. Keep toggle labels short and succinct.

Use this slot to provide the menu content. Use the "rh-menu" component 
for the menu panel, and use "rh-menu-items" to define the individual menu items.
To organize menu items into groups, use the "rh-menu-item-group" component.

declarations.name: RhNavigationLink
declarations.summary: A link that can be used as a child of navigation elements.
declarations.description:
Navigation Link is a link element that is used as a child of the primary, secondary,
subnav, and vertical navigation elements. Intrinsically, the Navigation Link is a list
item and should not be used outside of navigation elements that define the parent list element.

slots.name: icon
slots.description:
Use this slot when the `icon` and `icon-set` attributes are not set. 
Must be used in conjunction with the `href` attribute.  
Can contain a rh-icon, svg, or img tag.

The default slot should contain the link text when the `href` attribute is set. 
Alternatively, an anchor tag (`<a href="...">`) should be the first child inside
the slot. Slot should never contain a button tag.

slots.name: logo
slots.description: Use this slot to override the link and logo image for translations and sub sites.

Use this slot for `<rh-primary-navigation-item>` hamburger menu links and dropdowns.
If left empty will result in accessibility issues.

slots.name: event
slots.description:
Use this slot for event promotion.  Images such as SVGs and links are most often slotted here.
Slot these items using the `<rh-navigation-primary-item slot="event">` element. If any 
other element is slotted here, it will need to be a role="listitem" to avoid accessibility 
issues.  Other slotted elements will also likely have other rendering issues.

slots.name: links
slots.description:
Use this slot for quick links to other sites not directly associated with the page the
navigation is on.  Common use cases are developers docs and support. Slot these items using
the `<rh-navigation-primary-item slot="links">` element. If any other element is slotted 
here, it will need to be a role="listitem" to avoid accessibility issues.  Other slotted 
elements will also likely have other rendering issues.

slots.name: dropdowns
slots.description:
Use this slot for search, for you, and account dropdowns. Slot these items using the
`<rh-navigation-primary-item slot="dropdowns" variant="dropdown">` element. If any 
other element is slotted here, it will need to be a role="listitem" to avoid accessibility 
issues.  Other slotted elements will also likely have other rendering issues.

members.name: preventEscElements
members.default:
[
    'input:not([type="hidden"]):not([type="radio"])',

    // Elements that need the :disabled selector:
    ...[
      'input[type="radio"]',
      'select',
      'textarea',
      'rh-audio-player',
      'rh-dialog',
    ].map(selector => `${selector}:not([inert]):not([inert] *):not([tabindex^='-']):not(:disabled)`),

    // Elements that don't need the :disabled selector:
    ...[
      'iframe',
      'audio[controls]',
      'video[controls]',
      '[contenteditable]',
    ].map(selector => `${selector}:not([inert]):not([inert] *):not([tabindex^='-'])`),
  ].join(',')

declarations.description: Fired when a step becomes active

declarations.name: RhProgressStep
declarations.summary: Single step in a progress stepper
declarations.description:
A progress step represents a single step in a progress stepper.
Each step can have different states and may include an icon, label,
and description. Steps can also be linked to URLs.

members.name: state
members.description:
Sets the state of the progress step
- `inactive` - The step is not active
- `active` - The step is currently active
- `complete` - The step has been completed
- `warn` - The step is in a warning state
- `fail` - The step has failed
- `custom` - The step uses a custom icon

members.name: description
members.description:
Sets the description text for the progress step when more context is needed.
Descriptions are secondary to titles.

It is overridden by the `description` slot.

members.name: icon
members.description:
Can be used to set a custom icon for the step.
When the step is in the `warn` or `fail` state, it should not have a custom icon.
If there's no custom icon, the default active or inactive icon will appear.

It can be overridden by the `icon` slot.

members.name: iconSet
members.description: Icon set for the `icon` property - 'ui' by default

members.name: href
members.description:
Sets a URL to make the step's title clickable.
Only completed or current steps will appear linked.
The linked title will use our inline link styling, with gray, dashed underlines.

members.name: computeIcon
members.description:
Icons for each step indicates the status of a process or task.
Icons change as users progress.

Computes the icon for the step:

attributes.name: state
attributes.description:
Sets the state of the progress step
- `inactive` - The step is not active
- `active` - The step is currently active
- `complete` - The step has been completed
- `warn` - The step is in a warning state
- `fail` - The step has failed
- `custom` - The step uses a custom icon

attributes.name: description
attributes.description:
Sets the description text for the progress step when more context is needed.
Descriptions are secondary to titles.

It is overridden by the `description` slot.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Can be used to set a custom icon for the step.
When the step is in the `warn` or `fail` state, it should not have a custom icon.
If there's no custom icon, the default active or inactive icon will appear.

It can be overridden by the `icon` slot.

attributes.name: icon-set
attributes.description: Icon set for the `icon` property - 'ui' by default

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Sets a URL to make the step's title clickable.
Only completed or current steps will appear linked.
The linked title will use our inline link styling, with gray, dashed underlines.

events.name: change
events.description: fired when this step becomes active

slots.description:
A short title (1 to 3 words) for each step is required and serves as the step's accessible name.
Titles can be hyperlinked. Do not add punctuation to end.

slots.name: icon
slots.description:
Overrides the `icon` and `icon-set` attributes.
Prefer using the `icon` attribute and the (default) UI Icon set.
Avoid slotting content here if the step is in the `warn` or `fail` state,
Since those states should always show their prescribed icons.

slots.name: description
slots.summary: Elaborative, optional description for the step
slots.description:
Rich HTML content can be slotted here , to override the (plain text) `description` attribute.
Avoid slotting links, images, block-level content, etc.: descriptions should be prose only 
(around 40 characters or a max of 2 lines at the 768px breakpoint).

declarations.name: RhProgressStepper
declarations.summary: Communicate how many steps are required to complete a process
declarations.description:
A progress stepper conveys the steps necessary to complete a process or task, and the status of
each step. Steps have titles and descriptions; and each step can be in one of a number of possible states:
- inactive (yet to be performed)
- active (currently being performed)
- warn (succeeded, but with warnings)
- fail (failed to occur)
Or a custom state, set using the `icon` attribute.

## Usage guidelines
- Use 3-5 steps maximum to reduce cognitive load
- Designed to complement standard previous/next navigation. Avoid using as the only navigation.
- When process is completed, users cannot go back and must start over

## Accessibility
- Communicates list structure and step states to screen readers
- Supports keyboard navigation for linked step titles
- Maintains logical focus order (left to right, top to bottom)
- Provides aria-current for the active step

members.name: verticalAt
members.description:
Makes the element `vertical` at various container query based breakpoints.
Breakpoints available 'xs' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl' | '2xl'

Use when horizontal space becomes limited. The element automatically
changes to vertical orientation at screen sizes of <768px.

members.name: orientation
members.description:
Sets the orientation of the progress stepper.
- `horizontal` - Steps are displayed in a horizontal row (default)
- `vertical` - Steps are displayed in a vertical column

## Responsive behavior
- >992px: Padding between steps is set to --rh-space-5xl
- â‰¤992px: Padding reduces to --rh-space-2xl
- <768px: Orientation automatically changes to vertical

Use vertical orientation when horizontal space is limited or when
you need to display more detailed step information.

members.name: compact
members.description:
Makes element display as `compact`.

## Usage guidelines
- Use when there is limited space and less visual prominence is needed
- Maintain the compact size as designed - do not stretch spacing between steps
- Switch to default size or different orientation instead of stretching compact
- Always include step titles even in compact mode for accessibility

members.name: firstUpdated
members.description:
Initializes responsive behavior on first update.
Sets mobile state based on element width,
ensuring the stepper displays correctly on initial load.

members.name: verticalAtChanged
members.description:
Handles changes to the verticalAt property.
Updates the breakpoint threshold for responsive vertical orientation switching.

declarations.description:
A skeleton displays an animated placeholder that mimics the structure and layout of actual content while it loads.
It gives users a preview of what's coming and reduces perceived loading time.

members.name: type
members.description: What shape the skeleton should be. Defaults to `body-copy`.

members.name: size
members.description:
What size the skeleton should be. Defaults to `md`.
The `size` attribute is not valid on circle, square, or rectangle skeletons.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: What shape the skeleton should be. Defaults to `body-copy`.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
What size the skeleton should be. Defaults to `md`.
The `size` attribute is not valid on circle, square, or rectangle skeletons.

slots.description: Place a visually hidden description of what is being loaded for assistive technologies.

declarations.name: RhSkipLink
declarations.summary: Skip to the main content of a page
declarations.description:
A skip link is used to skip repetitive content on a page.
It is hidden by default and can be activated by hitting
the "Tab" key after loading/refreshing a page.

slots.description:
An anchor tag targeting the main page content by id hash.
Or, if the `href` attribute is set, the text of the link.

Sets color palette, which affects the element's styles as well as descendants' color theme.
Overrides parent color context.
Your theme will influence these colors so check there first if you are seeing inconsistencies.
See [CSS Custom Properties](#css-custom-properties) for default values

The color-palette attribute will be removed in a future release.

declarations.name: RhSurface
declarations.summary: Provides background color context for elements placed on top
declarations.description: Surfaces are content containers with a color palette which provide a theme (i.e. a background color as well as accessible font colors) to their child elements. Use surface only when other containers like card or accordion are inappropriate.

members.name: colorPalette
members.description:
Sets color palette, which affects the element's styles as well as
descendants' color theme. The default surface color palette is 'lightest',
Surface always overrides the parent's color context.
Your theme will influence these colors so check there first if you are seeing inconsistencies.
See [CSS Custom Properties](#css-custom-properties) for default values

attributes.name: color-palette
attributes.description:
Sets color palette, which affects the element's styles as well as
descendants' color theme. The default surface color palette is 'lightest',
Surface always overrides the parent's color context.
Your theme will influence these colors so check there first if you are seeing inconsistencies.
See [CSS Custom Properties](#css-custom-properties) for default values

slots.description: The `<rh-surface>` element has a single anonymous slot which accepts any content and does not provide additional layout styling

declarations.name: RhTileGroup
declarations.description: A group of `<rh-tile>` elements which handles radio selection.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Whether tile group interaction is disabled

members.name: radio
members.description: If tile is checkable, whether only one tile can be checked

members.name: colorPalette
members.description:
Sets color palette, which affects the element's styles as well as descendants' color theme.
Overrides parent color context.
Your theme will influence these colors so check there first if you are seeing inconsistencies.
See [CSS Custom Properties](#css-custom-properties) for default values

Tile group always resets its context to `base`, unless explicitly provided with a `color-palette`.

declarations.name: RhTooltip
declarations.summary: Reveals a small area of information on hover
declarations.description:
A tooltip is a floating text area that provides helpful
or contextual information on hover, focus, or tap.

members.name: position
members.description: The position of the tooltip, relative to the invoking content

members.name: content
members.description: Tooltip content. Overridden by the content slot

members.name: silent
members.description: When true, disables screen reader announcements for tooltip content. Only use when another accessible label is provided.

members.name: show
members.description: Show the tooltip

members.name: hide
members.description: Hide the tooltip

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: The position of the tooltip, relative to the invoking content

attributes.name: content
attributes.description: Tooltip content. Overridden by the content slot

attributes.name: silent
attributes.description: When true, disables screen reader announcements for tooltip content. Only use when another accessible label is provided.

slots.description:
Place invoking element here,
i.e. the element which when hovered the tooltip will display.
Must be inline content.

slots.name: content
slots.description: Place tooltip content here. Overrides the `content` attribute.
